alert.note: Alert for Livingston (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 29 at 1:49PM CST until February 02 at 6:00AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Louisiana, including the following parishes, Ascension, East Baton Rouge, Livingston and West Baton Rouge. * WHEN...Until 445 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 147 PM CST, Emergency management reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring. Between 4 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. Rain continues but is not expected to contribute to additional flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Baton Rouge, Oak Hills Place, Westminster, Inniswold, Village St. George, Gardere, Merrydale, Shenandoah and Old Jefferson. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
